    1568                 :            :             "  ],\n"
    1569                 :            :             "  \"removed\": [\n"
    1570                 :            :             "    <structure is the same as \"transactions\" above, only present if include_removed=true>\n"
    1571                 :            :             "    Note: transactions that were re-added in the active chain will appear as-is in this array, and may thus have a positive confirmation count.\n"
    1572                 :            :             "  ],\n"
    1573                 :            :             "  \"lastblock\": \"lastblockhash\"     (string) The hash of the block (target_confirmations-1) from the best block on the main chain. This is typically used to feed back into listsinceblock the next time you call it. So you would generally use a target_confirmations of say 6, so you will be continually re-notified of transactions until they've reached 6 confirmations plus any new ones\n"
    1574                 :            :             "}\n"

    2159                 :            :                 "\nUpdates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.\n"
    2160                 :            :                 "Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.\n"
    2161                 :            :                 "If no transaction outputs are specified when unlocking then all current locked transaction outputs are unlocked.\n"
    2162                 :            :                 "A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending bitcoins.\n"
    2163                 :            :                 "Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list\n"
    2164                 :            :                 "is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.\n"
    2165                 :            :                 "Also see the listunspent call\n",

    2997                 :            :                 "\nAdd inputs to a transaction until it has enough in value to meet its out value.\n"
    2998                 :            :                 "This will not modify existing inputs, and will add at most one change output to the outputs.\n"
    2999                 :            :                 "No existing outputs will be modified unless \"subtractFeeFromOutputs\" is specified.\n"
    3000                 :            :                 "Note that inputs which were signed may need to be resigned after completion since in/outputs have been added.\n"
    3001                 :            :                 "The inputs added will not be signed, use signrawtransactionwithkey\n"
    3002                 :            :                 " or signrawtransactionwithwallet for that.\n"
    3003                 :            :                 "Note that all existing inputs must have their previous output transaction be in the wallet.\n"
    3004                 :            :                 "Note that all inputs selected must be of standard form and P2SH scripts must be\n"
    3005                 :            :                 "in the wallet using importaddress or addmultisigaddress (to calculate fees).\n"
    3006                 :            :                 "You can see whether this is the case by checking the \"solvable\" field in the listunspent output.\n"
    3007                 :            :                 "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n",
    3008                 :            :                 {
    3009                 :            :                     {"hexstring", RPCArg::Type::STR_HEX, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The hex string of the raw transaction"},

    3168                 :            :                 "\nBumps the fee of an opt-in-RBF transaction T, replacing it with a new transaction B.\n"
    3169                 :            :                 "An opt-in RBF transaction with the given txid must be in the wallet.\n"
    3170                 :            :                 "The command will pay the additional fee by reducing change outputs or adding inputs when necessary. It may add a new change output if one does not already exist.\n"
    3171                 :            :                 "If `totalFee` is given, adding inputs is not supported, so there must be a single change output that is big enough or it will fail.\n"
    3172                 :            :                 "All inputs in the original transaction will be included in the replacement transaction.\n"
    3173                 :            :                 "The command will fail if the wallet or mempool contains a transaction that spends one of T's outputs.\n"
    3174                 :            :                 "By default, the new fee will be calculated automatically using estimatesmartfee.\n"
    3175                 :            :                 "The user can specify a confirmation target for estimatesmartfee.\n"
    3176                 :            :                 "Alternatively, the user can specify totalFee, or use RPC settxfee to set a higher fee rate.\n"
    3177                 :            :                 "At a minimum, the new fee rate must be high enough to pay an additional new relay fee (incrementalfee\n"
    3178                 :            :                 "returned by getnetworkinfo) to enter the node's mempool.\n",
    3179                 :            :                 {
    3180                 :            :                     {"txid", RPCArg::Type::STR_HEX, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The txid to be bumped"},
    3181                 :            :                     {"options", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "",
    3182                 :            :                         {
    3183                 :            :                             {"confTarget", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "fallback to wallet's default", "Confirmation target (in blocks)"},
    3184                 :            :                             {"totalFee", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "fallback to 'confTarget'", "Total fee (NOT feerate) to pay, in satoshis.\n"
    3185                 :            :             "                         In rare cases, the actual fee paid might be slightly higher than the specified\n"
    3186                 :            :             "                         totalFee if the tx change output has to be removed because it is too close to\n"
    3187                 :            :             "                         the dust threshold."},
    3188                 :            :                             {"replaceable", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "true", "Whether the new transaction should still be\n"
    3189                 :            :             "                         marked bip-125 replaceable. If true, the sequence numbers in the transaction will\n"
    3190                 :            :             "                         be left unchanged from the original. If false, any input sequence numbers in the\n"
    3191                 :            :             "                         original transaction that were less than 0xfffffffe will be increased to 0xfffffffe\n"
    3192                 :            :             "                         so the new transaction will not be explicitly bip-125 replaceable (though it may\n"
    3193                 :            :             "                         still be replaceable in practice, for example if it has unconfirmed ancestors which\n"
    3194                 :            :             "                         are replaceable)."},
    3195                 :            :                             {"estimate_mode", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "UNSET", "The fee estimate mode, must be one of:\n"
    3196                 :            :             "         \"UNSET\"\n"
    3197                 :            :             "         \"ECONOMICAL\"\n"
    3198                 :            :             "         \"CONSERVATIVE\""},
    3199                 :            :                         },
    3200                 :            :                         "options"},
    3201                 :            :                 },
